string-array.name: meal_activity_descriptions
string-array.item: Dishes that focuses on beef will primarily use a red wine to complement the dish
Dishes that focuses on pork will primarily use a red wine to complement the dish
Dishes that focuses on chicken will primarily use a red wine to complement the dish
Dishes that focuses on vegetables will primarily use water to complement the dish
Dishes that focuses on fish will primarily use a white wine to complement the dish
Dishes that focuses on shellfish will primarily use a white wine to complement the dish

string-array.name: drink_activity_titles
string-array.item: Sparkling? Fizzy is the way to go!

string-array.name: drink_activity_descriptions
string-array.item: Because of high amount of tannins in red wine, which causes bitterness and complements fatty foods, red wine tastes good with beef
Because of a lower amount of tannins in white wine, white usually pairs well with chicken and fish
Because of it\'s bubbles, sparkling is generally paired with shellfish and appetisers.
It is hard to generalize with rosé, but most rosés pair well with strong food or vegetarian foods.
Because of the alcohol burn from whiskey, you want fatty foods to mute the burn. So a good pairing for whiskey is beef, or even chocolate.
